attributes.action: Rescind the MBE from Phillip Green due to the collapse of the Arcadia group.
attributes.additional_details: We cannot standby and watch a business man play roulette with the finances of those that work for the Arcadia Group. People are losing their livelihoods whilst he views yachts overseas over a meagre £30 million pounds that could have saved the Arcadia Group. Compare that to his and his wife's accumulated wealth.
attributes.background: Phillip Green should have his MBE revoked due to his direct and obscene behaviour to his current and former staff. There is a gaping hole in the pension plan for current and future staff. He and his management team have overseen the demise on the high street. Yet he still profits from his wealth.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments, which includes requests for someone's MBE to be taken away.

Honours can be taken away from people who have done something to damage the honours system’s reputation, but this cannot be achieve by petition. You can find out more about how this works here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/having-honours-taken-away-forfeiture
